thread.title: Bournemouth 0-2 Manchester City PLAYER RATINGS: David Silva a joy to watch in win over Cherries
thread.title_full: Bournemouth 0-2 Manchester City PLAYER RATINGS: David Silva a joy to watch in win over Cherries

author: John Cross
title: Bournemouth 0-2 Manchester City PLAYER RATINGS: David Silva a joy to watch in win over Cherries
text:
Man City's David Silva takes on Jack Wilshere (Photo: Rex Features) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Raheem Sterling was the young flyer to deliver for Manchester City following the early injury exit of Gabriel Jesus. 
First the England winger tapped in for the first-half opener before providing the perfect cut-back for Sergio Aguero, whose touch knocked the ball onto defender Tyrone Mings, for the second after the break. 
Aguero got his chance following the 14th-minute injury suffered by the young Brazilian. 
While Bournemouth suffered their own star blow with Jack Wilshere limping off early in the second half. 
John Cross was at the Vitality Stadium to assess the players' performances. Manchester   celebratesRaheem Sterling and Fernandinho after scoring their second goal (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Bournemouth 
Solid performance after some recent inconsistent displays. 
Smith 6 
Solid defensively, tried to link up with Ibe and put in a good shift. 
Francis 6 
Hobbled off early on and the Bournemouth captain’s absence was a big blow. 
Cook 6 
City’s movement gave Cook problems, deflected one shot onto his own post. 
Daniels 6 
Made a goal saving block to deny De Bruyne. Good on the ball. 
Arter 6 
Always niggly, full of energy and tenacious. Vital to Bournemouth’s midfield. 
Surman 6 
Nicest man in football, but fairly unproductive night on the pitch. 
Fraser 5 
Booked. Subdued performance as he created little going forward. 
Wilshere 6 
Went off injured before half time. Had done well in front of Guardiola. Bournemouth's Jack Wilshere walks past manager Eddie Howe as he is substituted after sustaining an injury (Photo: REUTERS) 
Ibe 7 
Lively on his first start for a couple of months. Looked dangerous. 
King 7 
Had an effort ruled out for a shirt pull on Stones. It was the right call. 
Substitutes 
Mings, for Francis, 23 mins, 6 
Afobe, for Wilshere, 45 mins, 6 Manchester City 
Caballero 6 
Made a brilliant last ditch block to deny Ibe and is a better bet than Bravo. 
Sagna 7 
Excellent right back, always so steady and reliable. Solid defensively. anchester City's Willy Caballero saves from Bournemouth's Jordon Ibe (Photo: REUTERS) 
Stones 7 
Was fairly solid, had one scare but generally kept Bournemouth’s forwards quiet. 
Kolarov 6 
His distribution better than his defending. His mobility does help give an edge. 
Fernandinho 6 
Played as a makeshift left back, did well with some of his long range passing. 
Toure 6 
Booked. Having got an early booking, lucky not to get a second of foul on Afobe. 
De Bruyne 6 
Deeper midfield role suits his passing range. In good form. Manchester   scores their second goal (Photo: REUTERS) 
Silva 8 
MotM. Lovely passing, super skill and just runs the show. A joy to watch. 
Sterling 7 
Booked. If at first you don’t succeed… Clinical finish after another effort was deflected and provided for the second 
Jesus 5 
Went off injured early after twisting his ankle. Big blow, he’s been terrific. 
Sane 7 
Is getting better with each game, has so much pace and threat down the wing. 
Substitutes 
Aguero, for Jesus, 15 mins, 6 Like us on Facebook
